summary: An email sent to the SDNY Victim/Witness Coordinator reporting alleged child sex abuse and corruption in Maine, connecting individuals to the Epstein case and claiming protection of abusers by government officials. The sender alleges her daughter was abused by the father and that a wealthy lawyer conspired to take her child.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as having been arrested by SDNY, which prompted the reporting of other alleged child sex abuse concerns.

persons.name: Michael Waxman
persons.context: Described as a wealthy real estate lawyer from New England who allegedly stalked the sender, vowed to use his fortune to take her daughter, and is accused of having 'Epstein level wealth' and posting inappropriate pictures with a young boy.

persons.name: Igor Malenko
persons.context: Alleged father of the sender's daughter, confirmed for sex abuse of the 2-year-old, on an illegal green card, later given US citizenship, and sued a DA over a custody dispute.

persons.name: George Mitchell
persons.context: Mentioned as allegedly related to the Epstein case and as having been on Epstein's plane according to flight records; also credibly named as a child sex abuser/trafficker.

persons.name: Stephanie Anderson
persons.context: Portland Maine's District Attorney whom Igor Malenko sued when she attempted to uphold the law and enforce a joint custody judgment.

persons.name: Andrew Demers
persons.context: Went to jail for raping his own 4-year-old granddaughter and is now a registered sex offender; allegedly shut down cases related to child sex abuse.

persons.name: Bill Cohen
persons.context: Bill Clinton's Secretary of Defense, credibly named as a child sex abuser/trafficker; cases related to child sex abuse that he was involved with should have been re-opened.

persons.name: John Kenoyer
persons.context: Went to jail for raping a 10-year-old girl; the judge who protected him is the same one protecting Michael Waxman.

persons.name: Cynthia Wellman
persons.context: Sued the State of Maine claiming Maine government employees and UMO professors were running a child trafficking ring.

persons.name: Janet Mills
persons.context: Current Governor of Maine, alleged to have been instrumental in crimes against the sender and her daughter and in protecting Waxman/Malenko; also credibly named as involved in cocaine trafficking.

persons.name: Steve Webster
persons.context: Helped protect Waxman/Malenko, retired, and now presents himself as an expert on child sex trafficking.

persons.name: Donald Alexander
persons.context: The judge who protected John Kenoyer and is the same one protecting Michael Waxman today.

connections.description: Michael Waxman has been Igor Malenko's pro bono lawyer for more than a decade and has declared a personal interest in Malenko's daughter.
Judge Donald Alexander protected Michael Waxman from 13 counts brought by Maine Overseers of the Bar, similar to how he protected former FBI chief John Kenoyer.
Igor Malenko sued District Attorney Stephanie Anderson when she attempted to uphold the law and enforce a joint custody judgment he was violating.
George Mitchell was allegedly on Epstein's plane according to published flight records, connecting him to the Epstein case.
Governor Janet Mills is alleged to have been instrumental in protecting Waxman and Malenko from consequences for their actions.

events.title: Email Report to SDNY
events.description: An email was sent to the SDNY Victim/Witness Coordinator reporting alleged child sex abuse, grooming, and corruption in Maine, prompted by Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: SDNY press conference announcing the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell, which encouraged the public to report child sex abuse concerns.

events.title: Sex Abuse Confirmation of 2-Year-Old
events.description: The sender's 2-year-old daughter was confirmed for sex abuse by her father, Igor Malenko, by Maine's sexual assault forensic examiners.

events.title: Malenko Sues DA Stephanie Anderson
events.description: Igor Malenko sued Portland Maine's District Attorney Stephanie Anderson over her role in a custody dispute where he was illegally withholding his daughter.

events.title: Andrew Demers Conviction
events.description: Maine State Police Chief Andrew Demers went to jail for raping his own 4-year-old granddaughter and became a registered sex offender.

events.title: John Kenoyer Conviction
events.description: Maine's former FBI Bureau Chief John Kenoyer went to jail for raping a 10-year-old girl.

keyFacts: The sender alleges her 2-year-old daughter was confirmed as a victim of sex abuse by her father, Igor Malenko, who was on an illegal green card at the time.
Michael Waxman, a wealthy New England real estate lawyer, is accused of stalking the sender and vowing to use his 'vast family fortune' to take her daughter from her.
Multiple high-profile Maine figures, including former US Senators George Mitchell and Bill Cohen, are credibly named as child sex abusers/traffickers in the document.
The document claims systemic corruption in Maine, with government employees protecting alleged abusers like Waxman and Malenko, and failing to act on reports of child sex abuse.
The email was sent to the SDNY following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, as encouraged by authorities to report historical child sex abuse and grooming concerns.
